newsitem.title: USA: Loews Corp says Q2 hurt by investment loss.
newsitem.headline: Loews Corp says Q2 hurt by investment loss.

text.p: Loews Corp said Wednesday that it posted net investment losses of $212 million in the second quarter, ended June 30.

In a statement accompanying second quarter earnings, chief executive officer Laurence Tisch said "Loews from time to time has engaged in transactions which it considers hedges of corporate enterprise values."
He added that "the gains and losses on these hedge securities are marked to market and reflected in the company's income statement." He also said that Loews continues to maintain these positions.
Those losses, said Diana Temple, an analyst at Salomon Brothers, are not unusual. "Loew's has frequently been willing to take losses if they have had capital gains in the past," she noted.
The company reported second quarter earnings of $63.8 million, or $0.55 a share today, versus earnings of $378.7 million, or $3.25 a share in the year-earlier period.
